Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of frieze of female figures moving keft, holding hands (most of one woman and right arm and part of chiton of another preserved with flesh in added white and decorative short crosses in white on chiton).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd joins Oxford AN1896-1908-G.129.1c and belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.129.1a, AN1896-1908-G.129.1b and AN1896-1908-G.129.1e. It was transferred from the British Museum, where it had the reg. no. 1886,0401.1250 (Vase B102.26). Cook states that the coarse execution of the decoration on this vase is very unusual in Clazomenian black-figure. The fabric of the joining sherd was analysed by the Research Laboratory for Archaeology at Oxford. Using Ward's Method Cluster Analysis (WMCA) and Principal Components Analysis (PCA), the fabric found great similarities with the fabric from Wild Goat Style sherds found at Bayrakli in Asia Minor, which Dupont had attributed production to Clazomenae. Based on the similar composition types, Dupont then suggested that the place of production for the joining sherd ought to be situated near Clazomenae, Erythrae, or Teos (Boardman 1986, 664).
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 125, no. 17)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87 pl. X, no. 12b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.006) (Phase 1)
Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.26)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
Acquisition notes: The sherd was given to the Ashmolean Museum by exchange from the Trustees of the British Museum.
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 1886,0401.1250 (old British Musuem registration number)
